com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations

Class PolylineOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.annotations.PolylineOptions

  • public final class PolylineOptions
extends Object
    Builder for composing Polyline objects.

      • writeToParcel

        public void writeToParcel(Parcel out,
                          int flags)
        Flatten this object in to a Parcel.
        Parameters:
        out - The Parcel in which the object should be written.
        flags - Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or #PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE.

      • add

        public PolylineOptions add(LatLng point)
        Adds a vertex to the end of the polyline being built.
        Parameters:
        point - LatLng point to be added to polyline geometry.
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with the given point on the end.

      • add

        public PolylineOptions add(LatLng... points)
        Adds vertices to the end of the polyline being built.
        Parameters:
        points - LatLng points defining the polyline geometry.
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with the given point on the end.

      • addAll

        public PolylineOptions addAll(Iterable<LatLng> points)
        Adds vertices to the end of the polyline being built.
        Parameters:
        points - Iterable list made up of LatLng points defining the polyline geometry
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with the given points on the end.

      • alpha

        public PolylineOptions alpha(float alpha)
        Set the alpha value of the polyline.
        Parameters:
        alpha - float value between 0 (not visible) and 1.
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with the given polyline alpha value.

      • getAlpha

        public float getAlpha()
        Gets the alpha set for this PolylineOptions object.
        Returns:
        float value between 0 and 1 defining the alpha.

      • color

        public PolylineOptions color(int color)
        Sets the color of the polyline as a 32-bit ARGB color. The default color is black.
        Parameters:
        color - 32-bit ARGB color.
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with a new color set.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Gets the color set for this PolylineOptions object.
        Returns:
        The color of the polyline in ARGB format.

      • getPolyline

        public Polyline getPolyline()
        Do not use this method. Used internally by the SDK.
        Returns:
        PolyLine The polyline build by this class.

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Gets the width set for this PolylineOptions object.
        Returns:
        The width of the polyline in screen pixels.

      • width

        public PolylineOptions width(float width)
        Sets the width of the polyline in screen pixels. The default is 10.
        Parameters:
        width - float value defining width of polyline using unit pixels.
        Returns:
        This PolylineOptions object with a new width set.

      • getPoints

        public List<LatLng> getPoints()
        Gets the points set for this PolylineOptions object.
        Returns:
        a List of LatLngs specifying the vertices of the polyline.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Compares this PolylineOptions object with another PolylineOptions and determines if their color, alpha, width, and vertices match.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - Another PolylineOptions to compare with this object.
        Returns:
        True if color, alpha, width, and vertices match this PolylineOptions object. Else, false.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Gives an integer which can be used as the bucket number for storing elements of the set/map. This bucket number is the address of the element inside the set/map. There's no guarantee that this hash value will be consistent between different Java implementations, or even between different execution runs of the same program.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        integer value you can use for storing element.
